description: From Ancient Greek γαμετή (gametḗ, “wife”), γαμέτης (gamétēs, “husband”), ultimately from γάμος (gámos, “marriage”).

entries.meaning: (cytology) A reproductive cell (sperm in males or eggs in females), having only half of a complete set of chromosomes.
examples: Synonyms: sex cell, reproductive cell, germ cell
Hyponyms: spermatozoon, sperm, ovum, egg; see also Thesaurus:gamete
